_header: For lack of sight great cause I have to pleyne
_description: To his Mistress — eight 8-line stanzas including refrain, ‘Of my desire that I may ce ryghte noghte’, and four-line envoy.

BodTan346.First Lines:
For lak of sighte grete cause haue I to pleynelonge absence so sore
                    me werreyth…
BodTan346.Last Lines:
…Disdeyneth not but of godely hedeHaueth ther on mercy and
                    pite
BodTan346.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Pamela. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Tanner 346: A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1980.
